title: Quiz 7: Organisation of Health Services
description: Assess knowledge on the Ministry of Health's structure, from national to community levels.

questions.question: Arrange the administrative levels of the Ministry of Health from highest to lowest:
Who is the technical leader of health services at the National level?
questions.explanation: The Minister and PS are political/administrative. The DMS is the technical leader.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ is the basic organizational unit of government health services and the focus for rural development.
questions.explanation: The District is the key decentralized unit for service delivery.

questions.question: Which of the following are functions of the Ministry of Health? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: MoH handles policy, financing, training, and preventive/promotive/curative services (not just curative).

questions.question: The Provincial Medical Officer (PMO) is answerable to the District Medical Officer of Health (DMOH).
questions.explanation: The PMO is senior to the DMOH. The PMO answers to the Director of Medical Services.

questions.question: Match the organization to its category:
What is the abbreviated title of the officer in charge of health services at the District level?
questions.explanation: District Medical Officer of Health (DMOH) or Medical Officer of Health (MOH).
questions.hint: Acronym starting with D or M.

questions.question: Which level contains dispensaries and health centers?
questions.explanation: Dispensaries and health centers are at the Community/Peripheral level.
questions.hint: The level closest to the people.

questions.question: Which of the following are private health care institutions in Kenya? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: KNH is a public/government hospital. The others are private.
questions.hint: Which ones are not government run?

questions.question: Religious groups play a significant role in health care delivery by supplementing government services.
questions.explanation: Religious groups (Catholic, PCEA, etc.) provide significant health services, especially in rural areas.
